title.narrative: INVESTMENTS FOR CHILDREN

description.narrative: By 2025, relevant national and local public authorities and private sector actors have increased capacity to make child-friendly, effective and efficient use of public budgets and other social investments, which contributes to Private Sector Engagement, Reducing Child Poverty. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Harnessing Power Of Business And Markets, Partnerships And Engagement: Public And Private, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2025, public and private entities and civil society demonstrate a shared commitment and increased investments in child rights.

sector.narrative: Local governance related (national subnational, local) policies programmes, plans and/or budgets
PF4C: Engagement with budget processes to improve social sector budgets (sufficiency, efficiency, effectiveness, transparency, equity)

related-activity.ref: 4350/A0/06/884 EXPANDED ACCOUNTABILITY AND INVESTMENT FOR CR

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2025, relevant national and local public authorities and private sector actors have increased capacity to make child-friendly,effective and efficient use of public budgets and other social investments

description.narrative: UNICEF continued to engage with central and local government, NGOs and the private sector to increase their capacity to mobilize financial and non-financial resources for children, and especially for those most vulnerable and at risk of poverty, marginalization, and child labour. UNICEF partnership with private sector expanded this year to include international business. In line with emerging engagement under public finance for children, local governance stream also transitioned to a more planning and budgeting focused activities. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:21/01/2022

title.narrative: Status of TCOs business board for GenU, Text

actual.value: 2021:The Board was successfully established in June 2021 and follow-up meetings were performed in September and October. The 2nd Board meeting took place on 12 January 2022.

title.narrative: Status of TCOs business board for GenU, Text

actual.value: 2021:The Board was successfully established in June 2021 and follow-up meetings were performed in September and October. The 2nd Board meeting took place on 12 January 2022.

title.narrative: Status of SOPs/guidelines for the implementation of the National Programme on the Elimination of Child Labour, Text

baseline.value: SoPs for Provincial Units Combatting Child Labour, labour inspectors and any other tailored tools for spesific stakeholders in combatting child labour do not exist

target.value: 2025:Tools adopted and implemented accross the country and they become a part of national child labour elimination framework

actual.value: 2021:UNICEF TCO developed a set of Tools/Guides called Toolkit to Prevent and Respond to Child Labour in the Humanitarian Context of Turkey.

title.narrative: Status of SOPs/guidelines for the implementation of the National Programme on the Elimination of Child Labour, Text

baseline.value: SoPs for Provincial Units Combatting Child Labour, labour inspectors and any other tailored tools for spesific stakeholders in combatting child labour do not exist

actual.value: 2021:UNICEF TCO developed a set of Tools/Guides called Toolkit to Prevent and Respond to Child Labour in the Humanitarian Context of Turkey.
